page.topic: How to make a Checkbox Readonly
page.description: Learn how client-side enable expressions can be used to disable a checkbox, making it readonly.

description.p: A checkbox HTML element doesn't have a "readonly" property. Consequently, the only way to make a checkbox appear to be "readonly" is to disable the control. A checkbox control can be disabled in Alpha Anywhere using Client-side Enable Expressions.

Client-side enable expressions can be used to disable controls, creating a "readonly" effect. This method can be applied to a checkbox control in a component. The client-side enable expression can be a constant value or based on values in other fields in your component.

section.title: Creating a Static Client-side Enable Expression
section.description: If the checkbox control should always be readonly, define the checkbox control's *[ui:Enable expression]* as "1=0". The expression, "1=0", will always be false. When a *[ui:Enable expression]* evaluates to false, the control will be disabled.

section.title: Creating a Dynamic Client-side Enable Expression
section.description: If the checkbox control should be readonly only when data in another field in the component is a specific value, you can specify a dynamic *[ui:Enable expression]* that references the field. Click the [...] button for the checkbox control's *[ui:Enable expression]* property to open the client-side expression builder. Use the *[ui:Insert Field]* to insert a control into the expression.
